title: From Print Volumes to Digital Scholarship: The Handbook of Latin American Studies Web Archive
content: Since the 1930s, the Handbook of Latin American Studies has documented scholarship on Latin America and the Caribbean. In this interview, Tracy North describes how that long-standing mission now extends to web archiving, ensuring long-term access to web-based research materials. The conversation discusses the collaborative process of selecting websites to archive and the behind-the-scenes work involved in developing the collection. Please introduce yourself. What is your job at the Library of Co...
creator: Tracee Haupt Fugate
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Anywhere Adventures is Hitting the Road!
content:
We’re on the hunt for two U.S. communities to include in Vivian Li’s Innovator in Residence Project, Anywhere Adventures! 

Visitors to the mobile experience are currently able to explore three American communities, Seattl...
creator: Isabel Brador

title: Web Archiving at the Library After 25 Years
content:
This post is co-written by Abbie Grotke (Section Head), Amanda Lehman (Digital Collections Specialist), and Melissa Wertheimer (Senior Digital Collections Specialist) of the Web Archiving Section to close our 25th-anniversary celebration year with some highlights of the program.

We Have a History

In 2025 we wrapped up our 25th year of web archiving at the Library of Congress! We also ended the year with over 100 web archive collections availab...
creator: Melissa Wertheimer
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: What’s New Online at the Library of Congress: January 2026
content: Interested in learning more about what’s new in the Library of Congress digital collections? The Signal shares regular updates to our digital collections and we love showing off our colleagues’ hard work from across the Library. Read on for a sample of recent additions and a few favorite highlights.
creator: Carlyn Osborn
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Understanding AI at the Library: An Interview with Kurt Lemai-Nguyen
content:
In this interview, 2025 Library of Congress Junior Fellow Kurt Lemai-Nguyen reflects on his experience working to support understanding AI at the Library in the Library’s Digital Strategy Directorate. This interview has been edited for length and clarity.

title: Where Science Meets Storytelling: Twelve Years of the Science Blogs Web Archive
content: More than a decade after its launch, the Science Blogs Web Archive continues to grow and evolve. In this interview, Jennifer “JJ” Harbster reflects on building and maintaining the collection, while intern Yahir Brito brings a fresh perspective on updating and expanding it. Together...

title: Putting the American Revolution in Context Through Transcription
content:
